snippet: A half-dozen military supply stores are a source of military vests, camouflage pants, knives and gas masks for a clientele flooding in from all over the Middle East.
abstract: Antakya Journal; half-dozen military supply stores in this Turkish town near Syrian border are source of military vests, camouflage pants, knives and gas masks for clientele flooding in from all over the Middle East; store owners say where shoppers come from is not their business, but most recognize in private that they are foreign jihadis, mostly Sunni extremists drawn to fight Syria's Shiite-aligned government.
lead_paragraph: A half-dozen military supply stores are a source of military vests, camouflage pants, knives and gas masks for a clientele flooding in from all over the Middle East.

headline.main: Next Door to War, There’s Money to Be Made
headline.print_headline: Next Door to War, There’s Money To Be Made
